name: Relais Ducale Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at this 4-star hotel in May 2005, and found it very charming -- definitely the best in Gubbio. It is quite a climb up many steps, but generally worth the effort. Once in my room, I had a view of tiled rooftops (alas, not the broad vistas facing south) and the tower of the Palazzo dei Consoli, whose bells chimed every quarter hour. The 2 "gardens" at the hotel are wonderful places to sit with a drink and a book. Above the hotel (and Gubbio) is a lovely park, with a winding path for strolling. As a single traveler, one is always given the smallest room, which is a bit frustrating, but that seems to be normal for Europe. Compared to a 4-star in Rome, it was reasonably priced. I would only have a few negative comments: 1) The room was lovely and clean except that there was a bit of mold in the shower stall near the ceiling. Once noticed, it became bothersome. 2) The employees tend to over-recommend their affiliate restaurant, Taverna del Lupo. For the traveller on a budget, it seemed a bit pricey. A less expensive, but equally nice, alternative, is the Bosone Gardens Restaurant located in the Relais Ducale's sister hotel, the Hotel Bosone. I was surprised that it was not recommended as well. 3) I believe that there was car service which picked up and dropped off some guests, perhaps those who had driven to Gubbio and parked in a parking lot. However, I was not given any information about this (I had informed them that I had no car). Unfortunately, from the train station I had to walk up and down numerous cobbled steps pulling a heavy suitcase. Gubbio is a lovely town, not heavily touristed, but a bit on the "dull" side. For those wanting a clean, peaceful, and quiet few days, however, it is ideal, and the Relais Ducale Hotel is the place to pick.
reviews.title: Wonderful small hotel

reviews.text: we were guests of this marvelous hotel late may, 2004. from the moment we arrived we knew we had chosen one of the best. the staff is extremely helpful, we were upgraded to a beautiful suite overlooking the Stones City and were thrilled to find flower and chilled champagne awaiting us. the service was consistenly perfect. this hotel will forever be one of our all time favorites.
reviews.title: Marvelous Relais Ducale
Wonderful and Cozy Home in Umbria
reviews.text: Just spent six days at the Relais Ducale and enjoyed our stay immensely. The owners and the entire hard-working staff made us feel very welcome and they unfailingly went out their way to make sure we enjoyed our stay. Gubbio itself is a great base to explore Umbria and the Marches as it is within easy driving distance of Assisi, Perugia and Spoleto; as well as of the lovely towns on the Adriatic Coast. The town itself is a wonder of buildings and charming walkways all perched on a hill, filled with interesting shops and nice restaurants. Gubbio alone is worth a visit for a day or two! At the same time, it is not quite so touristy because real people live and work here, and they seem to all love it here, so you can have a nice feel of real Umbrian Italy by making your travelling base here.

reviews.title: Lovely hotel
reviews.text: Within Gubbio, this is unfailingly the best place to stay but it is also the priciest -- although room rates are still reasonable compared to the more touristy parts of Italy. The rooms are very comfortable and many have great views of the town and the Umbrian plains. The breakfast too is one of the nicest I have had in a country hotel, with freshly sliced meats every morning. Don't fail to have a gelato in the bar in the afternoon as well, as this is home-made and absolutely delicious.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on a cycling trip in Umbria and Tuscany and we stayed at Relais Ducale for one night. The hotel is located in the center of town with stunning views of the palaces on the main square. The room was beautifully furnished with antiques and breakfast was great (local meats, cheeses, fruits, pastry). Definitely the best out of many hotels that we stayed at. The staff was very helpful. The lady at the reception spent half an hour finding out some info about local buses for us. Everybody was very kind and helpful. I would love to come back there one day and would recommend it very highly to anyone.
reviews.title: Loved it!!!!
Felt like I was at home!
reviews.text: The Relais Ducale hotel immerses one who stays there in the history of the region while providing the best in modern ammenities. The staff was attentive, efficient, and warm to our travel group. Our requests for assistance in various matters were met with smooth and dignified responses.

One night here in glorious spring weather. Ideal location, right at the heart of old town. Darn difficult to find by car, had to get out and explore on foot. Room not large but well appointed, bathroom a bit cosy but adequate. Hadn't expected to climb three flights of stairs to reception. After a hard days sight-seeing this was definitely unwelcome although staff very helpful with bags and provide valet parking. NOT suitable for frail, disabled or simply exhausted.
reviews.title: Always on time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WORST: clock on Palazzo dei Populi boomed the hours EVERY QUARTER HOUR all night, (yes thats 4 x 12 booms between midnight and 1,00pm) and we were at back of hotel. I slept for about an hour in all, would never go back because of this torture.
reviews.title: Magical

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BEST: lovely little patios, gardens, furnishings and friendly helpful staff. Ideal for deaf mountain goat types.
reviews.title: OK but not Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights in Sept 2008. The hotel is located right on the main piazza with easy access to everything in Gubbio, partly in an old palazzo and partly in the buildings behind, all with internal connection. The room was spacious, clean and well appointed. Service was very good and all the staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Elegant with central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ducale for 6 nights in July, having booked directly with the hotel. We requested a junior suite with a terrace, and got a beautiful room (the Duke di Montefeltro suite I think) at the top of the hotel. The room was excellent, but it's crowning glory was the terrace, boasting stupendous views across Gubbio and the entire valley that lies before the town. Nothing short of breathtaking and definitely worth the (not inconsiderable) price. Room 402!
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: As noted, the room was excellent, fully equipped, with good air con, excellent bathroom, large and comfortable bed and nothing whatsoever to complain about.
reviews.title: TheDuke of Montefeltro Would be Pleased...

likes.liked: — authentically Umbrian,also the secret passageway that the Duke built(right near our room)
likes.disliked: — a slight damp smell (due to age of the building) which you become acclimated to

reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel
reviews.text: The service in the hotel was nothing short of outstanding in all respects. From our delightful welcome - we were even introduced to the dog - to the friendly and accommodating service at the bar and breakfast, the staff were faultless.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Incidentally, don't even try to drive up to the hotel, there's no point: just get to the Piazza Martiri in the centre of Gubbio and phone the Ducale and they will come and get you, guiding you - at some speed! - to an underground car park 5-10 minutes walk from the hotel (10 Euros a day roughly) and then shuttling you and your luggage to the hotel. Just drop them a mail in advance and they will give you all the details.
reviews.title: Loved the Relais Ducale!!

likes.liked: — Size of room and great view.

reviews.text: Having travelled throughout Europe and extensively in Italy it is not often that the hotel is working on all cylinders when you arrive. The staff were very gracious, informative and helpful. They have very large rooms for Italian standards and the hotel has access to virtually all of the great sight seeing since it's in the old part of Gubbio. You feel like you have stepped into the 15th century given the surroundings and the walled city.
reviews.title: Relais Ducale is the BEST, perfectly located in Gubbio

reviews.text: They have a restaurant that we would recommend, go late though (after 9 p.m.) or you will be only eating with other Americans not used to the Italian schedule. Defintely enjoy the breakfast, it was extensive and memorable.
reviews.title: Don't Miss This One!

reviews.text: Cannoy say enough nice things about this place!
reviews.title: A True Palace
Repeat stay at excellent hotel in fabulous Gubbio
reviews.text: Gubbio is a wonderful town and the Relais Ducale is the best. There is a beautiful courtyard (which our room overlooked) where you can have drinks, breakfast, meet friends, etc. The rooms are small but very nice and the bathrooms are excellent. There is an elevator to get from lobby to rooms or to bar or to breakfast. Also, there is another elevator in the other building which takes you to a beautiful rooftop garden where you can see on tothe main Piazza. The manager, Sean, is the most friendly, efficient, and accomodating hotelier that I have met in a long time. He made our stay special, including mowing the rooftop garden himself so it would be perfect for our cocktail hour. Don't miss the 2 restaurants owned by the same family that owns the hotel. Alla Balestra is casual and has a wonderful patio (we had lunch and dinner here) and Taverna del Lupo is a very special night occasion with outstanding service and exceptional food. Try both. The town is very hilly but fun to just walk around and relax in. Definitely off the beaten path and you don't have to fight the tour buses. The hotel will send down for your luggage.

reviews.title: A Wonderful Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed here because of the reviews - you should too! The hotel is very nice, Gubbio is spectacular. Great buildings, great views, great people. don't tell anybody! seriously, the town is being developed, lots of renovations going on. Now is the time to go before it is spoiled. Everyone at the hotel was helpful, considerate. we called the hotel when we got to the parking lot at the base of the town and they sent a very nice guy with a van to lead us through the streets of Gubbio to the hotel. the drive through those narrow and steep streets was worth the price of the hotel. Our room was nice, with a courtyard view. We sat at the hotel bar (which is at street level and feels like a cafe not a bar) at the end of the day and made a dinner of wine, bruschetta, dessert and gelato. perfect. The drive from Perugia, the nearest city was about 30 minutes on mostly mountain roads. Beautiful views - Italian drivers.

description: In the heart of this well preserved medieval town of Gubbio, you find an exclusive four-star hotel, the Relais Ducale, part of the Duke of Montefeltro's former palace. We have no words to describe the beauty of this property and the kindness of the people that will look after our precious guests. The style of the hotel, characterized by unique vintage furniture and precious old paintings, romantic gardens, the warm and welcoming atmosphere transmits a "home away from home" feeling.
